New Records: Germany achieved the biggest opening-game margin of victory in the tournament's history with a 5-1 win.
Florian Wirtz became Germany's youngest scorer in European Championship history at the age of 21.
Key Match Events: Florian Wirtz scored in the 10th minute.
Jamal Musiala scored in the 19th minute.
Kai Havertz converted a penalty in the 45'+1 minute.
Niclas Füllkrug scored in the 68th minute.
Emre Can scored in the 90'+3 minute.
Antonio Rüdiger scored an own goal in the 87th minute.
Ryan Porteous was sent off on the stroke of half-time for a studs-up challenge.
Pre-Game Insights: Germany captain Ílkay Gündogan had a good feeling before the game and was proved right.
Post-Match Reflections: Germany captain Ílkay Gündogan praised the team's intensity and outstanding first half.
Scotland captain Andy Robertson acknowledged the team's poor first half and praised their effort in the second half despite being down to 10 men.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Germany dominated possession from the start with Scotland defending high.
Toni Kroos provided a perfect 30-metre cross for Joshua Kimmich, leading to Florian Wirtz's goal.
Germany's next matches are against Hungary and Switzerland.
Scotland's next match is against Switzerland.
